item.title: Report E-2024080453
item.description:
Report E-2024080453

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 5, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN2014 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024080854
item.description:
Report X-2024080854

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024080854 The package contains 99.5% ethyl alcohol and does not have the proper diamond, OP900 or a hazmat label. The only indication that this package contained alcohol is a small orange sticker saying "High Impact Ethyl Alcohol". The package also had a cap come completely off during transport resulting in the majority of that jugs contents leaking out. 2. X-2024080987 The package contains 99.5% ethyl alcohol and does not have the proper diamond, OP900 or a hazmat label. The only indication that this package contained alcohol is a small orange sticker saying "High Impact Ethyl Alcohol". The package also had a cap come completely off during transport resulting in the majority of that jugs contents leaking out.

item.title: Report X-2024080975
item.description:
Report X-2024080975

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the DENR location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent found a plastic bucket and a plastic bottle inside. Packaged in plastic bags with packing paper for dunnage. The cap was loose of the plastic bottle causing it to spill all of the contents. The plastic bottle had a flammable liquid DG marking on it but no other labeling. There were no DG making or paperwork on the outside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held at the location.
